description: End users may experience unauthorized code execution on their systems due to a vulnerability in the Microsoft Windows Performance Data Helper Library. Specifically, after applying the updates referenced in KB5040442, KB5040431, and KB5040427, systems running various builds of Windows 10 and Windows 11 may show erratic behavior indicating a lack of integrity and increasing availability threats. Users might notice unexpected application crashes or security warnings related to suspicious activity, especially on affected builds like 10.0.22631.3880, 10.0.22621.3880, and 10.0.19045.4651. Effective mitigations must be ensured to avoid such consequences. Since the vulnerability is classified as important, timely patching is essential to prevent exploitation.
